metadata.title: CVE-2018-1092 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The ext4_iget function in fs/ext4/inode.c in the Linux kernel through4.15.15 mishandles the case of a root directory with a zero i_links_count,which allows attackers to cause a denial of service(ext4_process_freed_data NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) via a craftedext4 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-128-generic - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-lowlatency - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-4.4.0-128-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-128.154
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-128-generic - 4.4.0-128.154
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1091.99
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1094.99
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1061-aws - 4.4.0-1061.70
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1019-gcp - 4.13.0-1019.23
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1019-gcp - 4.13.0-1019.23
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1027-kvm - 4.4.0-1027.32
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1030-oem - 4.13.0-1030.33
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-128.154').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.99').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1094.99').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1061.70').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1019.23').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1027.32').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1030.33').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1008.10').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
